meanings.definition: to act in an excessively subservient manner
meanings.sent1: He kowtowed to his boss, always agreeing with everything she said.
meanings.sent2: The servant kowtowed to the king, following his every command without question.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kowtowed to the cat, letting her have the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The politician kowtowed to the lobbyists, giving in to their demands for favors.
meanings.sent5: She kowtowed to her parents, never expressing her own opinions.

meanings.definition: to show excessive respect or submission
meanings.sent1: The student kowtowed to the teacher, always praising her work.
meanings.sent2: The knight kowtowed to the queen, pledging his loyalty and service.
meanings.sent3: The robot kowtowed to its creator, following every command without question.
meanings.sent4: The athlete kowtowed to the coach, accepting all criticism and advice.
meanings.sent5: He kowtowed to tradition, never questioning the ways of his ancestors.

meanings.definition: to bow down deeply in a show of respect or submission
meanings.sent1: The monk kowtowed before the statue of Buddha, showing reverence.
meanings.sent2: The samurai kowtowed before his master, displaying loyalty and humility.
meanings.sent3: The child kowtowed to the magician, believing in his magical powers.
meanings.sent4: The actor kowtowed on stage, portraying a character of great humility.
meanings.sent5: She kowtowed to the elders, honoring their wisdom and experience.
